trial_identification.studytitle: Correlation between Mild Hypoxemia and Limb Skeletal Muscle Function in Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Pilot Study
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Correlation between Mild Hypoxemia and Limb Skeletal Muscle Function

interventions.interventions: The lung function was evaluated by spirometry and arterial blood gas analysis, and the functional evaluation by 6 minute walk distance and by isometric contraction of deltoid and quadriceps muscles. Observation time: one year

primaryOutcome.outcome: The mild hypoxemia and the precocious limb muscular disability have decrease functional capacity as main negative impact in COPD patients
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At first 6 minute walk distance (6-MWD) and at isometric contraction of deltoid and quadriceps muscles

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The arterial pressure of oxygen (PaO2) has important correlations with variables of muscular function
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At first isometric contraction of quadriceps

eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Concomitant heart failure, diseases with mobility impairment, and medical conditions that were contraindicated for exercise testing

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: R 05 Norte Lote 02 bl. B Apto 1304 Águas Claras 71907-720 Brasilia - DF Brazil

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Hopital Universitario de Brasilia L 02 Norte 605 70840050 Brasilia - DF Brazil

ethicsAndSummary.summary: To investigate the correlation between PaO2 and muscular strength, muscular fatigue and functional capacity in COPD patients

ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Campus Universitario Darcy Ribeiro - Asa Norte 70.910-900 Brasilia DF Brazil
